intro: Parapteroceras elobe, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact rosette, with leaves that are broad and heart-shaped. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Parapteroceras elobe is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
